text: Joab Hoisington was a major in the American Revolutionary war who notably led the Hoisington Rangers. He was born September 19, 1736 in Hartford, Connecticut to John Hoisington and Sarah Templar. He married Mary Boardman on January 14, 1759, in Connecticut, and they had eight children. He died February 28, 1777 in Orange, Vermont of smallpox. ==References== Category:1736 births Category:1777 deaths Category:Continental Army officers from Connecticut Category:Military personnel from Hartford, Connecticut Category:People of colonial Connecticut Category:Deaths from smallpox
title: Joab Hoisington
